results.title: Production systems. - 1.
results.creator_credit: Martin Green, Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
The principles applied to commercial plant production are studied by the examination of three case studies. The first is pasture management, where with expert help, resources must be carefully managed to ensure the quality of diary produce. The second case study highlights broad-acre crops, a six year cycle of crop rotation and crop diversity to ensure better economic returns. Lastly, the focus turns to modern orchards and their design in order to ensure increased yields and good crop management.

results.title: Production of foods
results.brief_description: in studying the technology and geography of food production, the following points are given attention: the relation of animal food production to plant food production; methods used to produce plant foods and animal foods; and the important function of the soil in all food production.
results.description: in studying the technology and geography of food production, the following points are given attention: the relation of animal food production to plant food production; methods used to produce plant foods and animal foods; and the important function of the soil in all food production.

results.title: Production of commercial gramophonic discs
results.creator_credit: P.J. Brook and South Australian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A look at the various processes involved in the making of a record - from the artists recording onto multi-track tapes, through to the marketing and distribution to the public. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.
results.creator_credit_for_label: P.J. Brook and South Australian Film Corporation
